thread.title: Hundreds of angry fans stuck in queues outside Etihad Stadium for first part of Manchester City vs Monaco game
thread.title_full: Hundreds of angry fans stuck in queues outside Etihad Stadium for first part of Manchester City vs Monaco game

author: Pete Bainbridge
title: Hundreds of angry fans stuck in queues outside Etihad Stadium for first part of Manchester City vs Monaco game
text:
News Hundreds of angry fans stuck in queues outside Etihad Stadium for first part of Manchester City vs Monaco game Reports came in of long lines of fans waiting outside the ground for more than 15 minutes after kick-off Share Get Manchester City FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Scores of Manchester City fans say they were delayed into the Etihad stadium for tonight’s game against Monaco. 
Angry Blues supporters took to social media to brand the queues ‘a joke’ and ‘stupid’. 
Reports came in of long lines of fans waiting outside the ground for more than 15 minutes after kick-off. 
One irate Blues season ticket holder, who did not want to be named but has been going to matches for the last 13 years, told the M.E.N: “I was queuing outside the east stand and there were kids waiting in the cold and wet. Read More 
It’s ridiculous. I got there about quarter past seven, not even that late. The queues got bigger and bigger. I gave up and went home.” 
Dozens more vented their anger on Twitter, with some blaming security and others the traffic. 
Luke Bardsley @Bardo34 posted : “Say it every week the queues at the Etihad to get in are stupid.” 
Stephen @stebruv added: “Queues a joke at Etihad loads outside cos of security.” 
Sparkyott tweeted: “Is there traffic problems in Manchester this evening, in the Etihad area ? Haven’t seen so many empty seats in a long time #MCFCvMonaco” 
Paul Hulme added: “Traffic must be bad in East Manchester tonight, so many empty seats #ChampionsLeague #again #massiveclub” Read More These pictures show the remarkable transformation of a woman horrifically scarred in an acid attack 
Danny Perring added: “I assume there’s traffic problems or something up with public transport in Manchester?!?” 
Allison Jane Smith said: “Well it’s not raining, so please tell me there’s really heavy traffic round the Manchester area?” 
The M.E.N have contacted Manchester City for a response. Like us on Facebook
